body.name: KEYFANCLUB 80mm Small Computer Fan with AC Plug, 110V 120V 220V 240V Fan with Speed Controller, Cooling for Gaming PC, Modem, Cabinet, Terrarium, Greenhouse
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 17 hrs 42 mins
features: 【Powerful fan 80mm】standard 80mm Computer fan, running speed is 1500rpm to 4500rpm, generating a constant and continuous flow of air keeping everything cool and temperatures down and if there is a need for more air flow the included dial controller allows you to increase the air flow.
【Controllable Speed】Allows you to vary the voltage / speed of the fans.you can adjust the fan’s speed to optimize the airflow and noise for your application.
【Dual Ball Bearing】 Which contribute to smooth running and a longer lifespan. Almost it can run 24/7 for over 6 years.
【Plug and Play】 The speed controller has a standard two prong wall plug feeding a power supply. enables the fan to be powered through an AC outlet; Just plug it into a socket and start the fan.
【Protective Grilles】Comes with grilles that you can fix them on both sides of fan to keep fingers away, This set also comes with bolts that thread into included rubber feet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fan to Controller
reviews.reviewText: Use this little fan to add extra cooling to a small computer and equipment rack. Has worked great to this point. When equipment needs more cooling I turn up the fan, and if less down the speed goes. Be cautioned, the length of cable between fan and controller and electric plug are both a little short. Espically the cable between fan and controller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My husband LOVES this little fan. He installed it in a cabinet style heater for the screened in porch and it Really blows the heat at you,,, he can sit out there, smoke a cigar, and still feel warm!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cheap fan for actively cooling any passively cooled electronics
reviews.reviewText: The assembly of this was fairly straightforward, however the way the feet attach to the grille is a little janky and makes the feet uneven. to work around this, I've just removed the bottom grille. The variable speed works good and on the low setting the sound this fan makes is almost imperceptible. I wish the actual control knob was mounted on the fan itself to eliminate a box midway down the cord.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Powerful little fan
reviews.reviewText: I got this fan because my internet modem was overheating, with all the devices that I have connected to it. So decided to place a fan and see if it helped. This fan did the trick on helping my modem/router lower its temperature and perform better.The fan itself feels of good quality and is very powerful with a nob to control the speed, the faster speeds do get just a little noisy but for the amount of air it pushes it's normal. It's been running for almost two months now and so far no problems, so very happy with the fan, and hopefully it lasts long. So for the performance, quality and use I give it 5 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent for the money.
reviews.reviewText: Out of the box, there was a tiny bit of plastic mold flash I didn't notice. I installed it and it was EXCEPTIONALLY loud as a result. It was small enough to pull off by hand and after doing so, it's basically fine. Good value for the money, just be aware if you run into a similar situation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Versatile Little Fan... So many potential uses
reviews.reviewText: I go this initially to use to remove fumes when soldering electronics projects, and it does a great job for that, but there are so many ways to use such a versatile little fan. Being able to plug it directly into a 110v outlet just provides so many options, and the variable speed controller lets one tune the speed and noise level to the use case. Eventually I adopted this to use in a DIY 3D printer enclosure to remove fumes from the enclosure before they could escape into the room. It has been fantastic for this use case, and the slightly noisy high speed wine when being run at higher speeds isn't an issue at all in that somewhat noisy environment. I found the kit to be very complete with high quality feet and finger guards making it safe to use on the desktop as well as inside an enclosure. Having permanently mounted it to the 3D printer enclosure, I find myself needing another one for all the miscellaneous other things it is can be useful for.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An excellent and highly utilitarian little fan
reviews.reviewText: I reviewed a very similar fan in the past, was really quite happy and impressed, and jumped on opportunity to review this one. Effectively, this is the same package as the other, and at the time of ordering, listed at very similar prices. The differences boil doing to minute, mostly cosmetic, differences in the fan and *slightly* shorter feet. Both have been in operation for over a few weeks, and both reach the same brutal speeds of 4000+ rpm.Honestly, my conclusions over there apply the same here: these fans are more than the sum of their parts. They are not piddly computer fans; they move large amounts of air when turned up. They're super easy to use, stand up on their sides quite well. Huge variation in fan RPM, everything from fully silent to really going.I genuinely am surprised by all of it. Both have been in near non-stop use from the moment they arrived at my door--thats how useful this is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Powerful but noisy
reviews.reviewText: This thing pushes air. Lots of it. When I cranked the power up to max, face-down, it lifted itself off the table. Keep fingers away from the blades, it will leave a painful mark!I ran it at full blast for 48 hours to see if anything developed. No change. I stuck a pen in it at full speed, it stopped, no damage to the blades (but no auto shutdown or anything, so it was drawing full power still--worrisome). I dropped it. I used it outside (for testing--this is NOT an outdoor fan) in the dust/dirt for a few hours (ensuring it got dirty.) It didn't break, slow, develop new noises, etc.It's loud. I'd say on par with one of those 1U server fans.Satisfied that it pushed air well, I cleaned it up and then stuck it to the passive vents on my PC case, it vented enough air to help cool the GPU while gaming. I think I'd use a quieter fan, for a gaming rig or home office though.Currently mounted to a switch in my server closet, and keeping the temperatures down. Ultimately this will get mounted to to a flex-arm on the workbench for ventilating and/or cooling items.After playing with it, I'm likely going to get more of these and connect them to computer controlled power, so I can control fan speeds/throughput with standard barrel connectors.All in all, I really like this thing, except for the noise. I would not use this fan if you need it running full blast, in any noise sensitive environment. If you can run slower, it would be OK in an office, bedroom, terrarium, etc. But at full power, the noise of this fan is more suitable for industrial/server room uses.
